body: That's obviously not the whole trace, but from what you have there, it's not even clear that there was a failure.
Copy-paste problems on my behalf, sorry. Will update momentarily.

Final output:

```
  1 failing
  1) Interop tests should pass server_streaming:
     Uncaught AssertionError: 3 === 4
      at ClientReadableStream.<anonymous> (/home/travis/build/grpc/grpc/src/node/interop/interop_client.js:159:12)
      at ClientReadableStream.emit (events.js:95:17)
      at /home/travis/build/grpc/grpc/src/node/src/client.js:386:16
```

Full log here:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/63581683/log.txt

My suspicion is that call.c is discarding the final message errantly.

Is there a way to run just the server_streaming interop test?
The simplest way would be to edit `test/interop_sanity_test.js` and, in the line with that description (`"should pass server_streaming"`), replace `it` with `it.only`
Alternately, if you don't want to edit anything, (from `src/node`) `./node_modules/mocha/bin/mocha --grep server_streaming`

Complete log of a failure:

I see the expected 4 SEND_MESSAGE ops from the server.
All 4 RECV_MESSAGE ops on the client are also posted.
Assuming that the last RECV_MESSAGE gets a null?
That should be how it works.
